LogInspectionRule.Name: Default Rules Configuration
LogInspectionRule.Description: Common configuration rules used the other Log Inspection Rules. By itself this rule does not inspect events, but is required for all the other Log Inspection Rules.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Mail Server - Microsoft Exchange
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Microsoft Exchange for events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows
NOTE: To use this Log Inspection Rule, Microsoft Exchange Server should be configured to forward logs in W3C Extended Log File Format. To enable this, check 'Enable Logging' in the 'Default SMTP Virtual Server Properties' dialog for the SMTP Virtual Server, in 'Exchange System Manager' .

LogInspectionRule.Name: FTP Server - Microsoft FTP
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Microsoft FTP for events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows
NOTE: To use this Log Inspection Rule, enable all Extended logging options of IIS FTP Server.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Events
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the event logs of Microsoft Windows (2000, XP, 2003) operating systems for events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Database Server - MySQL
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This rule inspects MySQL logs. For MySQL versions prior to 5.6, default LogType "mysql_log" is used in the rule. For MySQL versions above 5.5, please select 'syslog' LogType in the configuration tab.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Database Server - PostgreSQL
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect PostgreSQL for events.
Platform: All supported platforms

LogInspectionRule.Name: Network Monitoring Tool - Arpwatch
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Arpwatch for events.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: PBX Server - Asterisk
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Asterisk PBX Server for events.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Mail Server - Courier
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Courier Mail Server for events.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Webmail Client - Horde IMP
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Horde IMP for events.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Mail Server - IMAPD
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect IMAPD for events.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Authentication Module - Unix Pluggable Authentication Module
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Pluggable Authentication Modules for events.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Authentication Tracking
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect logs and reports on suspicious login activity. This is a generic rule that can be applied with any other rule that defines the group "authentication_success".
NOTE: This rule only works in conjunction with other rules that define the "authentication_success" group. Some rules that define the group include Application - Secure Shell Daemon (SSHD) , Microsoft Windows Events , Authentication Module - Unix Pluggable Authentication Module , etc.
Platform: All supported platforms

LogInspectionRule.Name: FTP Server - ProFTPD.
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect ProFTPD for events.
Platform: All supported platforms

LogInspectionRule.Name: Application - Samba
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Samba for events.
NOTE: This Log Inspection rule monitors Samba logs from the syslog(/var/log/messages). To be able to use this rule, Samba server should be configured to forward logs to the syslog.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Solaris Auditing - Basic Security Mode
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Solaris BSM Auditing for events.
Platform: Solaris

LogInspectionRule.Name: Application - Secure Shell Daemon (SSHD)
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Secure Shell Daemon (SSHD) for events.
Platform: Non Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Unix - Syslog
LogInspectionRule.Description:

Platform: Non Windows

Inspect Web Server IIS event logs for events.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Security Events
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the event logs of Microsoft Windows operating systems for Security events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows (2000, XP, 2003)

LogInspectionRule.Name: Terminal Server Security - Microsoft Windows
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Windows Terminal Server Events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Routing and Remote Access - Microsoft Windows RRAS Events
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the Windows event logs of Routing and Remote Access Server (RRAS).
Platform: Microsoft Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Firewall - Microsoft ISA Server
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Microsoft ISA Server event logs for events.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Remote Access Service - Microsoft Windows RAS Events
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the Windows event logs of Remote Access Service (RAS).
Platform: Microsoft Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Web Server - Microsoft IIS Server Shielding
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This rule is to lock down an IIS web server. So these services should ideally not change state on IIS Web server that is locked down. This is a very restrictive rule and hence we want to monitor all changes that happen on such a system.
Platform: Microsoft Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Security Events - 2
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the event logs of Microsoft Windows operating systems for Security events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows 2016, Windows 10, Windows 2012, Windows 2008, Windows 7, Windows 8 and Windows Vista

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Security Events - 1
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the event logs of Microsoft Windows operating systems for Security events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows 2016, Windows 10, Windows 2012, Windows 2008, Windows 7, Windows 8 and Windows Vista.

LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect logs of Microsoft SQL Server for events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows

Inspect ftpd for events.
Platform: AIX

LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspects the event logs of Microsoft Exchange Mail Server.
Platform: Microsoft Windows Version: Microsoft Exchange Mail Server 2003

LogInspectionRule.Name: Web Application - Wordpress
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This rule inspects Syslog for Wordpress related events.
Platform: All supported platforms

LogInspectionRule.Name: Application - Apache Hadoop
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Apache Hadoop logs
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Web Server - Nginx
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Nginx Server for Events.
Platform: All supported platforms

LogInspectionRule.Name: FTP Server - CompleteFTP
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This rule inspects CompleteFTP logs
Platform: Microsoft Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Application - Docker
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect Docker Daemon logs
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Security Events - 3
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the event logs of Microsoft Windows operating systems for Security events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows 2016, Windows 10, Windows 2012, Windows 2008, Windows 7, Windows 8 and Windows Vista.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Security Events - 4
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the event logs of Microsoft Windows operating systems for Security events.
Platform: Microsoft Windows 2016, Windows 10, Windows 2012, Windows 2008, Windows 7, Windows 8 and Windows Vista.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Auditd
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This rule will monitor events related to auditd
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Kubernetes
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspects the Kubernetes cluster logs.
Note: This LI rule requires configuration to detect the monitored logs. The user has to configure the log file path of "kube-controller-manager" and "kube-apiserver". Both can be found inside the "/var/log/containers" or "/var/log/pods" directories generally.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Sysmon Events - 1
LogInspectionRule.Description: This Log Inspection rule monitors the events generated by System Monitor (Sysmon). It is a Windows system service and device driver that, once installed on a system, remains resident across system reboots to monitor and log system activity to the Windows event log and provides detailed information about process creations, network connections, and changes to file creation time.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Sysmon Events - 2
LogInspectionRule.Description: This Log Inspection rule monitors the events generated by System Monitor (Sysmon). It is a Windows system service and device driver that, once installed on a system, remains resident across system reboots to monitor and log system activity to the Windows event log and provides detailed information about process creations, network connections, and changes to file creation time.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft PowerShell Command Execution
LogInspectionRule.Description: To detect Microsoft PowerShell command execution in Windows.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Trend Micro Apex One & OfficeScan Directory Traversal Vulnerability
LogInspectionRule.Description: Trend Micro Apex One and OfficeScan Server are vulnerable to directory traversal vulnerability. If exploited, could allow an attacker to access restricted directories and execute commands and it could lead to remote code execution.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Sysmon Events IDs
LogInspectionRule.Description: This Log Inspection rule monitors the all events generated by System Monitor (Sysmon) Tool.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows Management Instrumentation Events
LogInspectionRule.Description: This rule monitors selected WMI events for malicious activity.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability (CVE-2020-0601)
LogInspectionRule.Description: A spoofing vulnerability exists in the way Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source, aka 'Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability'. This LI rule detects any attempt to exploit this vulnerability in a patch Windows system.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Remote Desktop Services (ATT&CK T1021.001)
LogInspectionRule.Description: Inspect the event logs of Microsoft Windows Remote Connection Manager Terminal Services.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Export Certificate and Private Key
LogInspectionRule.Description: This rule monitors the export of a certificate and private key in Windows, via the local certificate services.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Docker Daemon Remote API Calls
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This is a rule to monitor the logs of any API calls to docker daemon using the remote API.
Platform: Non-Windows
This rule will work better and provide more results if the log level of the docker daemon is set to debug.
Obs: This rule won't work on systems that uses the journald for their logs such as Ubuntu 16.04+ and CentOS

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft Windows User Logon Events
LogInspectionRule.Description:
Inspect the event logs of Microsoft Windows operating systems for users successful logon events based on username and logon type id.
Platform: Microsoft Windows
Note: Configuration options are provided to set the username & logon type id, which needs to be monitored. Administrators are advised to configure this rule to make it work.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Trend Micro Deep Security Agent Removal Attempt
LogInspectionRule.Description: This rule detects any attempt to uninstall the Deep Security Agent from a host that has Agent Self Protection enabled.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Auditd - Mitre ATT&CK TA0007: Discovery
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This Log Inspection rule monitors auditd for events related to techniques that fall under MITRE ATT&CK Tactic TA0007: Discovery
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Auditd - Mitre ATT&CK TA0003: Persistence
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This Log Inspection rule monitors auditd for events related to techniques that fall under MITRE ATT&CK Tactic TA0003: Persistence
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Auditd - Mitre ATT&CK TA0004: Privilege Escalation
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This Log Inspection rule monitors auditd for events related to techniques that fall under MITRE ATT&CK Tactic TA0004: Privilege Escalation
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Auditd - Mitre ATT&CK TA0006: Credential Access
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This Log Inspection rule monitors auditd for events related to techniques that fall under MITRE ATT&CK Tactic TA0006: Credential Access
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Netlogon Elevation Of Privilege Vulnerability (Zerologon) (CVE-2020-1472)
LogInspectionRule.Description: This LI rule detects vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection attempt.

LogInspectionRule.Name: Auditd - Mitre ATT&CK TA0005: Defense Evasion
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This Log Inspection rule monitors auditd for events related to techniques that fall under MITRE ATT&CK Tactic TA0005: Defense Evasion
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Auditd - Mitre ATT&CK TA0008: Lateral Movement
LogInspectionRule.Description:
This Log Inspection rule monitors auditd for events related to techniques that fall under MITRE ATT&CK Tactic TA0008: Lateral Movement
Platform: Non-Windows

LogInspectionRule.Name: Microsoft LDAP Query Execution
LogInspectionRule.Description: To detect Microsoft LDAP query execution in Windows.
